intro: Anticlea nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's antclea, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is a low-growing shrub with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue to purple, and it produces small, spherical berries that contain toxic seeds. Anticlea nuttallii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
